reviews.text: My husband and I, seniros, stayed in Ambience Kin-Ha hotel in Cancun, Mexico for five nights. Hotel was clean, especially landscape (ground) workers keeping it adequate enough. We had very positive experience, visiting Mayan ruins outside of the city.
reviews.title: Inflexible restaurant personnel

reviews.text: I am diabetic and therefore I have to eat frequently. Small portion. One morning we had to meet the tour bus at 7:15 a.m. My husband went to the restaurant (free continental breakfast) to ask to box us breakfast. This particular waitor laughed at him as if he was saying, "Are you kidding me? Boxed lunch?" So he went to talk to the Front Desk manager who had him "box" breakfast for us. If he hadn't, probably I would have been fainted due to low sugar count. No place to buy or eat food during a 3-hour trip to Xcaret.
reviews.title: Laid back Amiance Villas

reviews.text: Second incident with the same waitor: Following morning we were meeting tour guide to go to Chichen Itza. We had enough time to have breakfast at the restaurant. I had one small sweet bread which I could not finish. I eat like a sparrow. Anyway, I asked the waitor I could take that one roll with me since it was a long hour traveling. He said, "NO!" I asked him to be flexible. He said it is against hotel rule to have any kind of food out of the restaurant. I would be dizzy if I dont't have anything in a 4-hour drive. He was adamant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only good thing about this place is the beach. If you read enough reviews you will notice lots of people telling the same review of having money stolen here. I am another victim of money missing from the safe in the room. $300 to be exact. The staff did one of their investigations which consisted of asking the maid if she took the money and that was the extent of it. The card reader held the proof that the maid was the only person to go into the room at the time the money was stolen and like everone else who has had this problem i was told to go to the police dept to make a report. This is the worst place to stay if you don't like to be robbed.
reviews.title: great place to get your money stolen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Cancun. I booked a standard room at Ambiance and got an upgrade for a studio =) Room was clean, towels and all toiletries available. AC works wonderful...breakfast was included. The hotel is nice and clean. Staff are very helpful...the BEACH --WOW is the best in the Cancun area.. white sand beautiful blue water. Chairs are always available. Restaurant by the beach is ok...kind of pricey.... One recommendation for everyone Cancun is very expensive so I suggest if you plan your trip make sure to get All Inclusive.
reviews.title: Great Beach Area!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wife and i had a Superb time at the Ambiance. The staff there was great! The breakfast was outstanding and part of the room price! The tour guy there "Javier" was extremely helpful...I recommend Him for any tours in Cancun. If you are there to Scuba...A small outfit named "ScubFreds" Javier will recommend highly as will we. Those guys are patient and Love what they do!! 5 stars. Also don't be afriad to ride the local buses they are safe and very inexpensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at Ambience Villas and I would return again, but its not the hotel for everyone. I think it was built in the early 1980's and its dwared by Presidente and Olean hotels which tower over the 3 or 4 story Ambience. When I walked by the nearby Riu Resorts, I suffered from momentary Resort Envy, until I realized they had very little beach compared to Ambience, and I heard people complain about fighting for pool chairs. Always had a nice Palapa on the beach or a chair available by the pool. My wife and I had the breakfast plan and it kept us both filled up until dinner--maybe it was the heat, but I was never hungry the whole vacation. I ate dinner once at Ambience and the food and svc. were reasonable and tasty. As for drinks, we bought our tequilla at Wal-Mart, froze it with mango and pineapple juice in quart sized thermos cups overnight and sipped it all afternoon around the pool.
reviews.title: Would Return, though not the resort for everyone

likes.liked: — Room was kept extremely clean, Pool was great and the BEACH was breath-taking!
likes.disliked: — The day the sewage came out of the shower drain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The warning I give is that I wouldn't stay on the 1 st floor again. We opted for the 1 BR with a kitchen and living room, and we didn't have hot water the first day. They tried to fix it and we got lukewarm. Midweek, sewage started bubbling up through the shower, and they PROMPTLY moved us upstairs. We got our hot water finally, and I noticed all week long that they were having to replace sections of PVC pipe that appeared to be leaking. Again, the hotel looked like it was built in the early 80's, but it is kept up, and some of the units look like they are owned and resided in year-round. Ambience probably isn't the only place in Cancun with some sewage issues, but they handled it quickly and professionally. I was gone ATV riding and my wife was alone in the room when it happened. It could have been worse if our luggage and stuff were on the floor and no one was there when the sewage started flowing up through the shower. What a stinky surprise that would have been. We didn't dwell on it and our vacation went on as planned.
reviews.title: Nice place for the price

likes.liked: — beach, staff, breakfast, view from our room, location

reviews.text: If you can get over resort envy for a better beach, and don't want to go the all-inclusive route for freedom to eat somewhere outside the resort, want peace and quiet and not a party at the resort every night, Ambience is the best value in Cancun.
reviews.title: The BEST beach in town

likes.liked: — Everything about the hotel was great.
likes.disliked: — Some guests need to remember than just because they are on vacation doesn't mean they need to be pigs. We saw some great examples of why the rest of the world hates Americans.

reviews.text: Language was never a problem, and the best source of information is Xavier, the guy who has an office space off to the side of the front desk, where you can book side trips. Made great recommendations for restaurants, where to find things and all the side trips he booked were as described and went off without a hitch. He is also who you talk to when you arrange your transfer to the airport when you leave Cancun, not the jerks in the airport. Some people booked trips outside the resort and got ripped off, so we stuck with Xavier.
reviews.title: Great Beach Location

aka: Beachscape Kin Ha Villas And Suites
description: Beachscape Kin Ha Villas and Suites features Cancun`s largest suites in an intimate setting of low rise buildings surrounded by lush gardens. Prime location in Cancun`s Hotel Zone, walking distance from top restaurants, entertaiment and exclusive shopping, 3 minutes driving to the challenging Robert Trent Jone Jr 18 hole Championship golf course.Beachscape Kin Ha Villas embodies a new and unique concept in Cancun: 130 air conditioned rooms, 1,2 and 3 bedroom Suites, beautifully apointed in an airy, tropical decor. Suites have fully equipped moder kitchen. All units have cable TV, Direct dial telephone, hairdryer, balcony or patio. Our kitchen is ready to fulfill the most demanding customers. A great variety of our dishes, made from fresh regional ingredients, makes Beachscape a delicious experience. Our Executive Chef, specialized in international cousine, making sure he satisfies all our guests appetite.
